page.title: 03Roman Wall
page.content: The northern section of our area is in the Northumberland National Park and contains some fine sections of the Roman Wall. Apart from local farmers using it as a convenient source of stone for building, it has been left undisturbed through the years and is now protected so that visitors can enjoy its forts and milecastles. Less than a mile to the west is the Roman Army Museum at Carvoran fort and a few miles to the east are the forts of Vindolanda and Housesteads which both have interesting museums to visit and excavations to watch. In the summer months many tourists stay in and around Haltwhistle, which helps our shops, hotels and bed and breakfast concerns remain profitable. This provides another source of employment in our area.
